  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (* Construction of the interference graph.
  17.    Annotate pseudoregs with interference lists and preference lists. *)

  19. module IntPairSet =
  20.   Set.Make(struct
  21. ‌    type t = int * int
  22. ‌    let compare ((a1,b1) : t) (a2,b2) =
  23.       match compare a1 a2 with
  24.         | 0 -> compare b1 b2
  25.         | c -> c
  26.   end)

  28. open Reg
  29. open Mach

  31. ‌let build_graph fundecl =

  33.   (* The interference graph is represented in two ways:
  34.      - by adjacency lists for each register
  35.      - by a sparse bit matrix (a set of pairs of register stamps) *)

  37.   let mat = ref IntPairSet.empty in

  39.   (* Record an interference between two registers *)
  40.   let add_interf ri rj =
  41.     if Proc.register_class ri = Proc.register_class rj then begin
  42.       let i = ri.stamp and j = rj.stamp in
  43.       if i <> j then begin
  44.         let p = if i < j then (i, j) else (j, i) in
  45.         if not(IntPairSet.mem p !mat) then begin
  46.           mat := IntPairSet.add p !mat;
  47.           if ri.loc = Unknown then begin
  48.             ri.interf <- rj :: ri.interf;
  49.             if not rj.spill then ri.degree <- ri.degree + 1
  50.           end;
  51.           if rj.loc = Unknown then begin
  52.             rj.interf <- ri :: rj.interf;
  53.             if not ri.spill then rj.degree <- rj.degree + 1
  54.           end
  55.         end
  56.       end
  57.     end in

  59.   (* Record interferences between a register array and a set of registers *)
  60. ‌  let add_interf_set v s =
  61.     for i = 0 to Array.length v - 1 do
  62.       let r1 = v.(i) in
  63.       Reg.Set.iter (add_interf r1) s
  64.     done in

  66.   (* Record interferences between elements of an array *)
  67. ‌  let add_interf_self v =
  68.     for i = 0 to Array.length v - 2 do
  69.       let ri = v.(i) in
  70.       for j = i+1 to Array.length v - 1 do
  71.         add_interf ri v.(j)
  72.       done
  73.     done in

  75.   (* Record interferences between the destination of a move and a set
  76.      of live registers. Since the destination is equal to the source,
  77.      do not add an interference between them if the source is still live
  78.      afterwards. *)
  79. ‌  let add_interf_move src dst s =
  80.     Reg.Set.iter (fun r -> if r.stamp <> src.stamp then add_interf dst r) s in

  82.   (* Compute interferences *)

  84. ‌  let rec interf i =
  85.     let destroyed = Proc.destroyed_at_oper i.desc in
  86.     if Array.length destroyed > 0 then add_interf_set destroyed i.live;
  87.     match i.desc with
  88.       Iend -> ()
  89.     | Ireturn -> ()
  90.     | Iop(Imove | Ispill | Ireload) ->
  91.         add_interf_move i.arg.(0) i.res.(0) i.live;
  92.         interf i.next
  93.     | Iop(Itailcall_ind) -> ()
  94.     | Iop(Itailcall_imm _) -> ()
  95.     | Iop _ ->
  96.         add_interf_set i.res i.live;
  97.         add_interf_self i.res;
  98.         interf i.next
  99.     | Iifthenelse(_tst, ifso, ifnot) ->
  100.         interf ifso;
  101.         interf ifnot;
  102.         interf i.next
  103.     | Iswitch(_index, cases) ->
  104.         for i = 0 to Array.length cases - 1 do
  105.           interf cases.(i)
  106.         done;
  107.         interf i.next
  108.     | Icatch(_rec_flag, handlers, body) ->
  109.         interf body;
  110.         List.iter (fun (_, handler) -> interf handler) handlers;
  111.         interf i.next
  112.     | Iexit _ ->
  113.         ()
  114.     | Itrywith(body, handler) ->
  115.         add_interf_set Proc.destroyed_at_raise handler.live;
  116.         interf body; interf handler; interf i.next
  117.     | Iraise _ -> () in

  119.   (* Add a preference from one reg to another.
  120.      Do not add anything if the two registers conflict,
  121.      or if the source register already has a location,
  122.      or if the two registers belong to different classes.
  123.      (The last case can occur e.g. on Sparc when passing
  124.       float arguments in integer registers, PR#6227.) *)

  126. ‌  let add_pref weight r1 r2 =
  127.     let i = r1.stamp and j = r2.stamp in
  128.     if i <> j
  129.     && r1.loc = Unknown
  130.     && Proc.register_class r1 = Proc.register_class r2
  131.     && (let p = if i < j then (i, j) else (j, i) in
  132.         not (IntPairSet.mem p !mat))
  133.     then r1.prefer <- (r2, weight) :: r1.prefer
  134.   in

  136.   (* Add a mutual preference between two regs *)
  137. ‌  let add_mutual_pref weight r1 r2 =
  138.     add_pref weight r1 r2; add_pref weight r2 r1 in

  140.   (* Update the spill cost of the registers involved in an operation *)

  142. ‌  let add_spill_cost cost arg =
  143.     for i = 0 to Array.length arg - 1 do
  144.       let r = arg.(i) in r.spill_cost <- r.spill_cost + cost
  145.     done in

  147.   (* Compute preferences and spill costs *)

  149. ‌  let rec prefer weight i =
  150.     assert (weight > 0);
  151.     add_spill_cost weight i.arg;
  152.     add_spill_cost weight i.res;
  153.     match i.desc with
  154.       Iend -> ()
  155.     | Ireturn -> ()
  156.     | Iop(Imove) ->
  157.         add_mutual_pref weight i.arg.(0) i.res.(0);
  158.         prefer weight i.next
  159.     | Iop(Ispill) ->
  160.         add_pref (weight / 4) i.arg.(0) i.res.(0);
  161.         prefer weight i.next
  162.     | Iop(Ireload) ->
  163.         add_pref (weight / 4) i.res.(0) i.arg.(0);
  164.         prefer weight i.next
  165.     | Iop(Itailcall_ind) -> ()
  166.     | Iop(Itailcall_imm _) -> ()
  167.     | Iop _ ->
  168.         prefer weight i.next
  169.     | Iifthenelse(_tst, ifso, ifnot) ->
  170.         prefer weight ifso;
  171.         prefer weight ifnot;
  172.         prefer weight i.next
  173.     | Iswitch(_index, cases) ->
  174.         for i = 0 to Array.length cases - 1 do
  175.           prefer weight cases.(i)
  176.         done;
  177.         prefer weight i.next
  178.     | Icatch(rec_flag, handlers, body) ->
  179.         prefer weight body;
  180.         let weight_h =
  181.           match rec_flag with
  182.           | Cmm.Recursive ->
  183.               (* Avoid overflow of weight and spill_cost *)
  184.               if weight < 1000 then 8 * weight else weight
  185.           | Cmm.Nonrecursive ->
  186.               weight in
  187.         List.iter (fun (_nfail, handler) -> prefer weight_h handler) handlers;
  188.         prefer weight i.next
  189.     | Iexit _ ->
  190.         ()
  191.     | Itrywith(body, handler) ->
  192.         prefer weight body; prefer weight handler; prefer weight i.next
  193.     | Iraise _ -> ()
  194.   in

  196.   interf fundecl.fun_body; prefer 8 fundecl.fun_body
